item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS Delhi, Priyanka Gandhi, JP Nadda reach hospital - The Times of India
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS Delhi, Priyanka Gandhi, JP Nadda reach hospital

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has been admitted to AIIMS Delhi, prompting visits from notable leaders including Priyanka Gandhi and JP Nadda.

  • Manmohan Singh was hospitalized for medical evaluation.
  • Priyanka Gandhi and JP Nadda visited the hospital to check on Singh's condition.
  • The visit comes amidst concerns regarding Singh's health.
“We are all praying for his speedy recovery,” a spokesperson said.

Manmohan Singh's hospitalization has drawn public concern, highlighting the political and personal support from leaders across party lines.

item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to hospital, condition critical - The Hindu
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS hospital

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: PTI

Former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, 92, has been admitted to the emergency department of All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi, on Thursday (December 26, 2024).

  • He is currently in the emergency department of AIIMS.
  • The hospital has not yet released any details about his health status.
(More details awaited)

This admission raises concerns among supporters and the public regarding the health of the former leader.

item.title: Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum

Published on: 26 December 2024, 15:20 IST

The Narendra Modi government is evaluating a proposal to reduce income tax for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakhs per annum in the upcoming budget to alleviate the financial burden on the middle class amid a slowing economy.

  • The tax cut could potentially benefit many taxpayers, especially in urban areas with high living costs.
  • Indian taxpayers currently have the option between two tax systems: a legacy plan with exemptions and a newer, less complicated system introduced in 2020.
  • No definitive decision has been made on the size of the tax cuts; considerations will continue until the union budget announcement on February 1.
  • The reduction in taxes may encourage more people to choose the newer tax system.
  • The middle class is facing political pressure due to high taxes alongside slow wage growth and rising inflation.
“More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy, the world's fifth biggest.”

item.title: Cops Leaked Anna University Sexual Assault Victim's Identity, Alleges Tamil Nadu BJP - News18
item.description:
Tamil Nadu BJP Condemns Identity Leak of Anna University Sexual Assault Victim

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: News18

The Tamil Nadu BJP has accused the state's police of leaking the identity of a sexual assault victim connected to an incident at Anna University, where a 19-year-old student was attacked.

  • The incident took place on December 23, with the victim's details allegedly made public through the FIR.
  • BJP leader Annamalai has urged action against the officials responsible for this breach.
  • The accused is reportedly linked to DMK’s local leadership and has a history of similar crimes.
  • DMK leaders have denied the allegations, insisting the accused is not a primary member of their party.

“This heinous and imprudent act of the TN police is a blatant breach of the rights of the victim.” – Annamalai

The BJP is calling for urgent reform and accountability in handling sensitive cases involving victims of sexual assault.

item.title: 2024: When Supreme Court was busy fighting troubling remarks by HC judges - The Hindu
item.description:
2024: When Supreme Court was busy fighting troubling remarks by HC judges

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court of India faced significant challenges in 2024 due to several controversial remarks made by High Court judges, leading to public outcry and judicial scrutiny.

  • The Supreme Court addressed a troubling trend of communal and sexist remarks from High Court judges.
  • Five-judge benches were established multiple times to manage the impact of these comments.
  • Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav from the Allahabad High Court faces a pending motion for removal initiated by 55 Rajya Sabha MPs.
  • Justice Yadav's remarks about the Muslim community drew considerable backlash, emphasizing the divide in societal views.
  • In contrast, the Supreme Court responded differently to Justice V. Srishananda's remarks, highlighting a disparity in judicial handling.
  • Issues of political bias in the Calcutta High Court also prompted Supreme Court intervention, exemplifying ongoing tensions within the judiciary.
“The answer to sunlight is more sunlight. The answer is not to close our doors and shut out everything.” - Chief Justice D.Y. Chandrachud

The year marked a continual struggle for the judiciary to maintain integrity and public trust amid rising tensions and controversial statements.

item.title: China approves world’s largest, $137-billion dam on the Brahmaputra close to the Indian border - The Hindu
item.description:
China Approves Construction of World's Largest Dam on the Brahmaputra River

Published on December 26, 2024 by The Hindu

China has approved the construction of the world’s largest dam, costing $137 billion, on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, close to the Indian border, raising concerns among neighboring countries.

  • The dam is planned to be built at a gorge where the Brahmaputra makes a U-turn into India and then flows into Bangladesh.
  • It is part of China’s 14th Five-Year Plan and seeks to control water flow in the region, elevating fears of potential flooding during conflicts.
  • The dam will have the ability to generate over 300 billion kWh of electricity annually — enough for 300 million people.
  • The project poses significant engineering challenges due to its location along a tectonic plate boundary.
  • The Chinese government emphasizes the project’s role in environmental sustainability and national security, alongside providing significant economic benefits to the Tibet region.
“The lower reaches area features a vertical drop of 2,000 metres over a 50km distance, representing nearly 70 million kilowatts of resources that could be developed.” - Yan Zhiyong, Chairman of Power Construction Corporation of China

This dam not only focuses on hydropower but also aims to promote cooperation in South Asia and enhance energy resources.

item.title: 'Need to give chance to new power, leadership': Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debac - The Times of India
item.description:
Need to give chance to new power, leadership: Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debacle

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

During a recent Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting, leader Mallikarjun Kharge emphasized the need for leadership change following the party's performance in the assembly polls. He called for a new approach to revitalize the party's image and outreach.

  • Kharge stresses new leadership is essential after recent electoral setbacks.
  • Focus on revitalizing the Congress party's approach to connect with voters.
  • Calls for introspection and strategic planning to regain lost ground.
“We must give a chance to new power and leadership to reinvigorate our party.”

This meeting marks a significant moment for the Congress party as it seeks to address its challenges and reshape its future direction.

item.title: Budget 2025: Govt may cut income tax rates to lift consumption, say report - Business Standard
item.description:
Budget 2025: India Considers Income Tax Cuts to Boost Consumption

Publication Date: January 2025  Source: Reuters

India is looking into potential income tax reductions for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakh to support the middle class and stimulate consumption amid economic challenges.

  • The proposal aims to aid millions of taxpayers, particularly in urban areas facing high living costs.
  • Taxpayers have the option to choose between two tax systems: one allowing exemptions and the other with lower rates but no major exemptions.
  • A final decision on the cuts will be made closer to the budget announcement on February 1.
"More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy."

While the government grapples with high inflation and political pressure regarding tax rates, the proposed cuts aim to alleviate the financial burdens faced by many.

item.title: Supreme Court Collegium recommends advocate Pravin Sheshrao Patil as Judge of Bombay High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Collegium recommends advocate Pravin Sheshrao Patil as Judge of Bombay High Court

Published on: 26 Dec 2024, 10:42 am

The Supreme Court collegium has recommended the elevation of advocate Pravin Sheshrao Patil as a judge of the Bombay High Court.

  • The recommendation was made at a meeting held on December 22, 2024.
  • The official statement from the Collegium confirmed the proposal for Sheshrao Patil's appointment.
  • The Bombay High Court currently has 67 judges, leaving 27 vacancies from its sanctioned total of 94 judges.
  • Other high courts are also receiving new judge appointments, including Allahabad, Rajasthan, and Uttarakhand.
"The Supreme Court Collegium in its meeting held on 22nd December, 2024 has approved the proposal for appointment of Shri Pravin Sheshrao Patil, Advocate, as a Judge of the High Court of Bombay."

This move is expected to help fill the judicial vacancies in the Bombay High Court, enhancing its capability to address cases effectively.

item.title: BPSC 70th CCE prelims re-exam row: Delhi tutor held for protests by civil service aspirants in Patna - The Hindu
item.description:
Protests by Civil Service Aspirants Lead to Arrest of Delhi Tutor in Patna

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A Delhi-based tutor was arrested for allegedly instigating civil service aspirants to protest against a recent Bihar Public Service Commission examination. Protests escalated outside the BPSC office in Patna when aspirants demanded its cancellation.

  • The tutor, identified as Rohit, mobilized protesters who attempted to enter the BPSC office.
  • Authorities are investigating a larger conspiracy and the source of funding for the protests.
  • The police faced criticism for their handling of the protests, with reports of injuries among aspirants.
  • Prominent figures condemned the police action, calling it excessive and unjustified.
“Police action against BPSC aspirants was highly condemnable. Protesting BPSC aspirants should not have been treated like this. My support is always with the students.” - Motiur Rahman Khan, vlogger.

The arrests and protests highlight ongoing tensions surrounding the BPSC examinations and the broader issues of public protest rights in Bihar.

item.title: Collegium recommends appointment of judicial officer as Uttarakhand High Court judge - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Collegium Recommends Judicial Officer for Uttarakhand High Court

Published on: 26 Dec 2024, 10:33 am

The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the appointment of Judicial Officer Ashish Naithani as a judge of the Uttarakhand High Court.

This decision was taken at a meeting of the Collegium conducted on December 22, chaired by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna.

  • The Uttarakhand High Court currently has a sanctioned strength of 11 judges but is operating with only 6 judges.
  • This leaves 5 vacancies in the court that need to be filled.
“The appointment of Ashish Naithani is a significant step in filling the judicial vacancies in the Uttarakhand High Court,” said a source.

This recommendation reflects the ongoing efforts to address judicial shortages in the Uttarakhand judiciary.

item.title: Embarrassing Moments Of 2024 When Judges Sparked Controversies With Unthoughtful Comments - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Embarrassing Moments Of 2024 When Judges Sparked Controversies With Unthoughtful Comments

Publication Date: 2024-12-10 | Source: Live Law

This article discusses various embarrassing moments in 2024 when judges made controversial remarks that led to judicial scrutiny, underscoring the challenges of public perception in a digital age.

  • Justice BV Nagarathna criticized judges for being active on social media.
  • Former judge Abhijit Gangopadhyay resigned to join the BJP, raising questions of judicial independence.
  • Justice Rajbir Sehrawat from Punjab and Haryana High Court made disparaging comments about the Supreme Court.
  • Justice Vedavyasachar Srishananda exhibited communal and gender biases in court statements.
  • Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav faced backlash for remarks made during a VHP event.
“Judicial discipline in the context of the hierarchical nature of the judicial system is intended to preserve the dignity of all institutions.”

The events highlighted in 2024 illustrate the ongoing issues surrounding judicial accountability and public expectations in the age of social media.

item.title: Collegium recommends appointment of advocate Praveen Kumar Giri as Allahabad High Court judge - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Collegium Recommends Praveen Kumar Giri as Judge of Allahabad High Court

Published on: 26 Dec 2024, 10:29 am

The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the appointment of advocate Praveen Kumar Giri as a judge of the Allahabad High Court.

The decision was taken by the Collegium headed by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna on December 22.

"The Supreme Court Collegium in its meeting held on 22nd December, 2024 has approved the proposal for appointment of Shri Praveen Kumar Giri, Advocate, as a Judge of the High Court of Judicature at Allahabad," the resolution said.

As on December 1, the Allahabad High Court is functioning with 81 judges as against its sanctioned strength of 160, a vacancy position of 79.

This appointment highlights the ongoing efforts to fill judicial vacancies in the Allahabad High Court.

item.title: Three-year-old girl trapped in Rajasthan's borewell for over 70 hours: What happened so far - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Three-Year-Old Girl Trapped in Borewell for Over 70 Hours in Rajasthan

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A three-year-old girl named Chetna has been trapped in a 700-foot borewell in Rajasthan for over 70 hours while playing near her father's farm. Rescue operations are currently ongoing with teams working tirelessly to extricate her safely.

  • Chetna fell into the borewell around 3 PM on Monday.
  • Rescue teams, including the NDRF and SDRF, were formed and began operations within hours of the incident.
  • Efforts have included digging a parallel tunnel to reach the girl and overcoming challenges posed by compact soil due to moisture.
  • On Tuesday, rescuers managed to pull her up 30 feet and are continuously providing oxygen.
  • The rescue operation has reached a critical phase, and officials hope for a successful outcome soon.
Yogesh Kumar Meena, NDRF team in charge, stated, "We have to dig to 170 m deep down to reach the trapped girl."

Authorities remain hopeful for her safe rescue as efforts continue amidst challenging conditions.

item.title: ‘Ishwar Allah tero naam’: Protest erupts over bhajan at Vajpayee tribute event in Patna, BJP’s Shahnawaz Hussain calls it ‘height of intolerance’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Ishwar Allah tero naam’: Protest erupts over bhajan at Vajpayee tribute event in Patna

Date: Not specified
Source: The Indian Express

At a Patna function to commemorate the life of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, a protest erupted when noted folk singer Devi sang the lines “Ishwar Allah tero naam” during her rendition of Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram.

  • Around 50 protesters disrupted the singing of the bhajan closely associated with Mahatma Gandhi.
  • BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain labeled the protest as “the height of intolerance.”
  • Event organizer Ashwini Kumar Choubey condemned the disruption, stating it should not have occurred.
  • Singer Devi expressed her disappointment over the protest against a revered bhajan.
  • Participants in the event included former Union ministers under Vajpayee's government.
“What happened was unfortunate.” - Folk singer Devi
“The protest of the bhajan is the height of intolerance.” - Shahnawaz Hussain

The event aimed to honor Vajpayee's contributions, but the protest highlights ongoing tensions regarding religious expressions in public commemorations.

item.title: 'Congress's history is country's history': Karnataka Dy CM Shivkumar ahead of CWC meeting in Belgavi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Karnataka Dy CM Shivakumar Highlights Congress's Role Ahead of CWC Meeting

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar stated that the Congress party is integral to the country's history and continues to support all sections of society, even when in opposition.

  • Shivakumar acknowledged the significance of Congress in maintaining national unity.
  • The Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting is being held in Belagavi to commemorate the centenary of the 1924 Congress session.
  • Both Shivakumar and CM Siddaramaiah paid homage to Mahatma Gandhi prior to the meeting.
  • CWC meetings aimed to strategize for the upcoming political landscape, ensuring strong leadership within the INDIA alliance.
“Congress's history is the country's history; Congress has kept this country united.” - DK Shivakumar

The CWC meeting reflects Congress's continued relevance and its efforts to engage with historical legacies.

item.title: He took retirement for wife; she collapsed at his farewell! they took her to hospital, but she was… - India.com
item.description:
He took retirement for wife; she collapsed at his farewell! they took her to hospital, but she was…

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: India.com

A heart-wrenching incident unfolded in Kota, Rajasthan, when a government employee’s farewell party turned into a tragedy. Devendra had taken voluntary retirement to care for his ailing wife, Deepika, but tragically, she collapsed and passed away during the celebration.

Key Points:

  • Devendra dedicated his retirement to caring for his wife, who had health issues.
  • The farewell party, meant to celebrate his retirement, ended in disaster as Deepika collapsed.
  • A video of the incident went viral, showing the couple moments before the collapse.
  • Despite immediate help, Deepika was pronounced dead at the hospital.
  • Public reactions on social media expressed grief and suggestions for emergency preparedness.
"राजस्थान के कोटा जिला में एक भावुक घटना घटित पत्नी की देखभाल के लिए वॉलंटरी रिटायरमेंट लिया, लेकिन रिटायरमेंट का जश्न मनाते हुए पत्नी ने इस दुनिया को अलविदा कह दिया।"
— Banwari Lal – Bairwa (Civil Engineer)

The incident reveals the profound unpredictability of life during significant moments and highlights Devendra's commitment.
